gameText: Relocate Jar Jar to a battle just initiated at an adjacent site. OR Increase Jar Jar's landspeed by 1 for remainder of turn. OR If Jar Jar on Brisky Morning Munchen, take him into hand.

title: No Giben Up, General Jar Jar!
lore: 'Mesa think of sumting!'
gameText: If you just lost a Gungan from table, place him in your hand. OR If Jar Jar and Tarpals are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.

title: Take This!
lore: 'And this!'
gameText: If you are about to draw weapon destiny for Proton Torpedoes, instead draw 3 and choose 1. OR For rest of turn, add 2 to any attempt to 'blow away' Blockade Flagship. OR Take Proton Torpedoes or Bravo Fighter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

title: We Don't Have Time For This
lore: Amidala and Panaka have the weapons training to pin down and remove the greatest combat threat.
gameText: If Amidala and Panaka are in a battle together, add two battle destiny. OR Target an interior Naboo site where opponent has a battle droid. Draw destiny. If destiny > number of battle droids at that site, one of them is lost (opponent's choice).

title: Wesa Gotta Grand Army
lore: 'Gungans no die'n without a fight.'
gameText: USED: Take a Fambaa, Battle Plains, or Boss Nass' Chambers into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Subtract one from any just drawn weapon destiny. LOST: Target an opponent's undercover spy with your Gungan. Target is lost.

title: Whoooo!
lore: 'Look! One of ours, out of the main hold!'
gameText: Take a unique (•) N-1 starfighter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If a battle was just initiated at a system where opponent has a droid starfighter, all droid starfighters at that system are power -1 for remainder of turn.

title: Blockade Flagship: Docking Bay
locationDarkSideGameText: Your Docking Bay transit from here requires 1 Force. If just 'blown away', lose 4 Force.
locationLightSideGameText: This site may not be converted.

title: Naboo: Boss Nass' Chambers
locationDarkSideGameText: Opponent may not Force drain here. Immune to Revolution.
locationLightSideGameText: Once per game may take Boss Nass into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

title: Boss Nass
lore: Ankura Gungan who is the leader of his people. Prone to nervous tics. Personally responsible for uniting the Ankura and Otolla races together.
gameText: While at an underwater site and all of your characters on Naboo are Gungans: add one battle destiny in battles at Naboo sites and once during your deploy phase may deploy a Gungan or Steady, Steady from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

title: Naboo: Otoh Gunga Entrance
locationDarkSideGameText: Cards with ability (except Gungans) deploy +4 to underwater sites. Immune to Revolution.
locationLightSideGameText: Your Gungans deploy -1 here and move from here for free. You may not Force drain here.

title: Naboo: Theed Palace Hallway
locationDarkSideGameText: If your battle droid present, Force drain +1 here.
locationLightSideGameText: Once per game may take Ascension Guns into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

title: We Have A Plan
gameText: Deploy Theed Palace Throne Room, Theed Palace Hallway, and Theed Palace Courtyard. For remainder of game, you may not deploy cards with ability except [Episode I] Jedi, aliens, [Episode I] vehicles, Republic characters and [Republic] starships. Your Destiny is suspended. You lose no Force to Vengeance Of The Dark Prince. While this side up, you may not deploy characters to interior Naboo sites. Once per turn, may activate 1 Force. Flip this card if you control Theed Palace Throne Room (with Amidala there).

title: They Will Be Lost And Confused
gameText: While this side up, you lose no more than 2 Force to any Force drain. Your [Republic] starships are power +2 and immunity to attrition of [Trade Federation] starships is canceled. If opponent just drew a battle destiny greater than three, you may use 1 Force to cancel that battle destiny. During your control phase, opponent loses 2 Force for each battleground site you control with Amidala or Panaka. Flip this card if opponent controls Theed Palace Throne Room.

title: Bravo 1
lore: Ric Olie's starfighter at the battle of Naboo. Control configuration modified by Ric himself.
gameText: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Ric piloting, immune to attrition < 4 and draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.

title: Bravo 2
lore: Starfighter assigned to Officer Dolphe at the battle of Naboo. Damaged when the Trade Federation first invaded his planet, but Dolphe was able to make the necessary repairs.
gameText: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Dolphe piloting, immune to attrition < 4. While at Naboo system, your Bravo Squadron pilots at same system are forfeit +2.

title: Bravo 3
lore: Arven Wendik's starfighter at the Battle of Naboo. Oldest starfighter in the Naboo corps.
gameText: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add one pilot. While Arven piloting, immune to attrition < 4. While at Naboo system, opponent's battle destiny draws are -1 here.

title: Bravo 4
lore: Flown by Rya Kirsch at the Battle of Naboo. Bravo 4 was primarily used as a recon vessel before it began its assault on the Trade Federation's Droid Control Ship.
gameText: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Rya piloting, immune to attrition < 4. While at Naboo system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.

title: Bravo 5
lore: Ellberger's starfighter at the battle of Naboo has excellent evasion capabilities, and can remain a threat to its target for as long as possible.
gameText: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Ellberger piloting, immune to attrition < 3. While at Naboo, opponent's battleships present are power -1.

title: Bravo Fighter
lore: Flown by an unknown pilot who likes to spin a lot. Played the deciding role in the attack against the Droid Control Ship.
gameText: Permanent pilot provides ability of 3. During your control phase, if landed aboard Blockade Flagship, may draw one destiny. If destiny > 6, place Bravo Fighter in your Used Pile; Flagship 'blown away.'

title: Fambaa
lore: Pack animal domesticated by Gungan warriors. Able to bear heavy loads, even during the heat of combat.
gameText: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability = 1/2. Requires +1 Force to use landspeed. May not be attacked by creatures.

title: Boss Nass
lore: Ankura Gungan who is the leader of his people. Prone to nervous tics. Personally responsible for uniting the Ankura and Otolla races together.
gameText: While at an underwater site and all of your characters on Naboo are Gungans: add one battle destiny in battles at Naboo sites and once during your deploy phase may deploy a Gungan or Steady, Steady from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

title: Gian Speeder
lore: Military repulsorlift armed with three light repeating blasters. With a top speed of 160 kilometers per hour, they have the ability to out-flank an opponent in battle.
gameText: May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. May move as a 'react' to Naboo sites. Your battle destiny draws are +1 for each of your Royal Naboo Security present. (Limit +3.)

title: Kaadu
lore: Used by many Gungan warriors due to their fearless nature. Kaadu lay large numbers of eggs to compensate for those eaten by predators.
gameText: May add 1 'rider' (passenger). Ability = 1/2. Moves for free. While 'ridden' by a Gungan, may move as a 'react.' While at a swamp, adds 1 to your Force drains there.

title: Amidala's Blaster
lore: Amidala's ability as a warrior is underestimated by those who encounter her. With her weapon of choice, she often uses this fact to her advantage.
gameText: Deploy on Amidala. May target a character or creature for free. Draw destiny. Character is power and forfeit = 0 if destiny > defense value. Creature lost if destiny +2 > defense value.

title: Booma
lore: Lunched from fambaa-mounted catapults. Gungan 'energy balls' are used to disable a variety of mechanized threats. Effectiveness is enhanced by the skill of the user.
gameText: Deploy on your Fambaa. Twice during battle may draw destiny. If destiny < total number of opponent's characters and vehicles present, one of them is lost (opponent's choice).

title: Captain Tarpals' Electropole
lore: Tarpals' electropole is nearly as old as he is. Used to enforce the laws of Otoh Gunga.
gameText: Deploys on Captain Tarpals. May 'throw' (place in Used Pile) to target a character, creature or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > defense value, target is landspeed = 0 and power -3 for remainder of turn.

title: Electropole
lore: Gungan weapon that is very similar to the Force pike. Used to control crowds, wild animals, and the occasional battle droid.
gameText: Deploy on your Gungan. May target a character for free. Draw destiny. If destiny > defense value, character is power -4 for remainder of turn. At the end of battle here, may place this electropole on top of Reserve Deck.

title: Proton Torpedoes
lore: Mainstay weapon of Naboo Defense Fighters. Anakin Skywalker used them to surprising effect, as soon as he found the trigger.
gameText: Use 1 Force to deploy on your N-1 starfighter. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw Destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value. While on Bravo Fighter and you are attempting to 'blow away' Blockade Flagship, adds 2 to your total.

title: Nothing Can Get Through Our Shield
gameText: Non-pilot characters aboard starships are forfeit -4. Whenever a player's starship is 'hit', that player loses 1 Force (2 if starship was hit by Droid Starfighter Laser Cannons). At systems where you have only [Trade Federation] starships, all of those starships are immune to attrition < 4. At sites related to a system you occupy, your battle destinies may not be canceled by opponent.

title: The Deflector Shield Is Too Strong
gameText: Landed starfighters and vehicles aboard starships are forfeit = 0. Once during your control phase may target your droid starfighter and opponent's starfighter present at same system. Both players draw destiny. You add your starfighter's power and maneuver. Opponent adds starfighter's power. Starship with lowest total is lost.

title: 3B3-10
lore: Infantry battle droid who assumed command after his regiment's commander fell to Amidala's blaster. Re-routed Droid Control Ship order to himself in the heat of battle.
gameText: While at Theed Palace Hallway, opponent's characters may not move from here. Once per game may take Halt! Into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

title: Captain Tarpals
lore: Gungan leader of the forces that patrol and protect the city of Otoh Gunga. Consistently placed in the top ten of the Big Nasty Free-For-All.
gameText: Adds 1 to power of your other Gungans at same site. Opponent's characters may not move to underwater sites. Once per turn, if you just drew a Gungan for battle destiny, may deploy that Gungan for free to cancel that destiny and re-draw.

title: 3B3-1204
lore: Infantry battle droid programmed with anti-Jedi combat tactics by the blockade flagship. Was to begin uploading his program to the rest of the unit when the Jedi escaped.
gameText: While with two other battle droids, may use 1 Force to target an opponent's Jedi present. Target's immunity to attrition is canceled for remainder of turn.

title: 3B3-888
lore: Infantry battle droid belonging to the squad that captured Jar Jar Binks and Captain Tarpals at the Naboo battle plains.
gameText: Once per turn may use 1 Force to target an opponent's character present; target is defense value -3 for remainder of turn. While with another battle droid at a site, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.

title: Battle Droid Officer
lore: Leader. Officer battle droids contain programming that permits them to adapt to unusual situations. Known to malfunction from time to time.
gameText: Your infantry battle droids deploy -1 to same site. While with another battle droid, adds 1 to your total battle destiny here. Your battle droids may move to this site for free.

title: Battle Droid Pilot
lore: Pilot battle droids require navigational programming not found in other types of battle droids. Therefore, even though they lack weaponry, their manufacturing cost is still the same.
gameText: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 while piloting a battleship). While piloting a battleship, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.

title: Bok Askol
lore: At birth, a Pacithhips gene configuration usually indicates if they're to become a farmer, an intellectual, or a warrior. Bok Askol's destiny remained a mystery for years.
gameText: Once during your deploy phase, may draw destiny: (0-2) no result; (3-4) Askol draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise for remainder of turn; (5+) Askol is power +4 for remainder of turn.

title: Captain Daultay Dofine
lore: Neimoidian captain of the Trade Federation Droid Control Ship blockading Naboo. Cowardly, lazy, and extremely greedy.
gameText: Adds 3 to power of any capital starship he pilots. Once per game may take Activate The Droids into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While aboard Blockade Flagship, it is immune to attrition < 5 and Activate The Droids is immune to Alter.

title: Darth Maul With Lightsaber
lore: 'Yes, my Master.'
gameText: Permanent weapon is •Maul's Double-Bladed Lightsaber (twice per battle, may target a character for free; draw two destiny; target 'hit,' and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).

title: Darth Sidious
lore: Mysterious Sith Master who is manipulating the Trade Federation for his own nefarious ends. Shrouded in mystery, his identity and agenda remain unclear.
gameText: While no other characters present, if opponent just lost a Jedi from table, may lose 1 Force to place that Jedi out of play. While on Coruscant, may use 1 Force to add one battle destiny in a battle your Neimoidian is in. Immune to attrition.

title: Darth Sidious
lore: Mysterious Sith Master who is manipulating the Trade Federation for his own nefarious ends. Shrouded in mystery, his identity and agenda remain unclear.
gameText: While no other characters present, if opponent just lost a Jedi from table, may lose 1 Force to place that Jedi out of play. While on Coruscant, may use 1 Force to add one battle destiny in a battle your Neimoidian is in. Immune to attrition.

title: Corporal Rushing
lore: Royal Naboo security officer in charge of protecting Amidala's Throne Room. His wife and children were captured when the Trade Federation invaded the planet.
gameText: Deploys -1 to Naboo. While firing a blaster, adds one to total weapon destiny. Once per battle, if a battle droid was just hit by a blaster here, battle droid is lost and opponent loses 1 Force.

title: Infantry Battle Droid
lore: Main unit of the Trade Federation droid army. Cheap to manufacture. Required to be in contact with a Droid Control Ship at all times.
gameText: Power +1 in battles you initiate. Once per turn, if this droid just fired a blaster and 'hit' an opponent's character, opponent loses 1 Force. Opponent's Gungans and Republic characters present are forfeit -1.

title: Nute Gunray, Neimoidian Viceroy
lore: Neimoidian leader. Viceroy to the Trade Federation, but primarily under the influence of Darth Sidious. Ordered to take control of Naboo, and force the Queen to sign a treaty.
gameText: Your [Presence] droids and AATs are destiny +1 if drawn for battle or weapon destiny. Once per turn, may take Take Them Away into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < X, where X = twice the number of [Presence] droids present.

title: Nute Gunray, Neimoidian Viceroy
lore: Neimoidian leader. Viceroy to the Trade Federation, but primarily under the influence of Darth Sidious. Ordered to take control of Naboo, and force the Queen to sign a treaty.
gameText: Your [Presence] droids and AATs are destiny +1 if drawn for battle or weapon destiny. Once per turn, may take Take Them Away into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < X, where X = twice the number of [Presence] droids present.

title: OOM-9
lore: Officer battle droid who acted as a unit leader in the attack against the Gungans. Required advice from the Droid Control Ship in order to defeat the Gungan energy shield.
gameText: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. May add or subtract one from a just drawn Energy Shell weapon destiny draw here. While at Battle Plains, twice per game may take Open Fire! or Cease Fire! into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

title: OWO-1 With Backup
lore: Trade Federation battle droid leader assigned to take a squad and destroy what was left of the Jedi ambassadors. His mission went unaccomplished.
gameText: Requires +2 Force to use Landspeed. Power +1 for each opponent's Jedi present. While with a battle droid at a site, draws two battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Opponent's Force drains are -1 at adjacent sites.

title: Rayno Vaca
lore: Coruscant taxi driver who barely makes enough money to get by. Will try any trick in the book to get an extra credit from his customer.
gameText: Your characters may move from here using their landspeed for free. During your control phase, may place Vaca in Used Pile to take Lana Dobreed into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

title: Rune Haako, Legal Counsel
lore: The Trade Federation's only Neimoidian leader to have ever encountered a Jedi Knight. Assumed Daultay Dofine's responsibilities after Dofine questioned their Sith Lord's plans.
gameText: While at Theed Palace Throne Room, your attrition against opponent in battles at same and related Naboo sites is +X, where X = number of battle droids present at that site. While with a battle droid, Haako is power and defense value +2.

title: Rune Haako, Legal Counsel
lore: The Trade Federation's only Neimoidian leader to have ever encountered a Jedi Knight. Assumed Daultay Dofine's responsibilities after Dofine questioned their Sith Lord's plans.
gameText: While at Theed Palace Throne Room, your attrition against opponent in battles at same and related Naboo sites is +X, where X = number of battle droids present at that site. While with a battle droid, Haako is power and defense value +2.

title: Sil Unch
lore: Neimoidian Trade Federation Droid Control Ship officer. Specialized in battle droid control programming and interfaces. Does not enjoy being commanded by Daultay Dofine.
gameText: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While aboard a battleship, that battleship is immune to attrition < 4 and draws a battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

title: SSA-1015
lore: Security battle droid whose programming assured him a Jedi could be subdued. Supposed to be designated SSA-101, but a mistake in production pushed him back to 1015.
gameText: While with an opponent's Jedi, your other battle droids present are power +1. Opponent's Jedi are deploy +4 to same site. While with another battle droid at a site, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.

title: Dams Denna
lore: Knowledgable animal trainer and herd-master. Collector of Linn'con memorabilia.
gameText: Once during your deploy phase, you may deploy a Kaadu, Fambaa or Eopie to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If you just lost a creature vehicle from same site, you may place that creature in your Used Pile.

title: SSA-306
lore: Security battle droid was assigned guard duty at Theed Palace. His shift can only be ended by a blaster shot.
gameText: At same site, opponent's spies and smugglers are deploy +4 and may not apply their ability toward drawing battle destiny. While with another battle droid at a site, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.

title: SSA-719
lore: Security battle droid assigned to quell uprisings before they have a chance to gather momentum. Believes the best form of defense is offense.
gameText: While with another battle droid, power +3. If with a battle droid on Naboo and you just verified opponent's Reserve Deck, may lose 2 Force to search that Reserve Deck and place one card you find there out of play.

title: Tank Commander
lore: AATs require officer battle droids to command them and relay orders from the Droid Control Ship. Programmed with sophisticated tank warfare tactics.
gameText: Adds 3 to power of any AAT he pilots. While piloting an AAT, forfeit +2, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise, and your other [Presence] droids at this site are immune to attrition < 4.

title: Activate The Droids
lore: The activation of droids requires a transmission from a Droid Control Ship on a top-secret frequency. Only a Trade Federation captain has access to these frequencies.
gameText: Deploy on your Blockade Flagship (may not deploy on a site). Whenever you initiate a battle at a related planet site where you have a battle droid, you may activate 2 Force or retrieve 1 Force.

title: After Her!
lore: 'This one's a decoy!'
gameText: If opponent just Force drained you at a location, deploy on that location. Opponent's Force drains here are +1. Your battle destiny draws here are +1. If you control this location, may place Immediate Effect in Used Pile to retrieve 4 Force. (Immune to Control.)

title: At Last We Are Getting Results
lore: First sign that your blockade is going well: the Queen's on the comlink.
gameText: Deploy on table. Your [Trade Federation] starfighters are forfeit +2. During every draw phase, opponent loses 1 Force unless they occupy a battleground system. Effect lost if you do not occupy two battleground systems with [Trade Federation] starships.

title: Droid Racks
lore: The Trade Federation utilizes such efficient methods of droid deployment that it is rumored even they do not know exactly how many battle droids are in circulation
gameText: Use 4 Force to deploy on table. If your battle droid was just lost, may place it here. During your control phase, may use 2 Force (1 Force if your piloted MTT on table) to take any battle droid from here into hand. (Immune to Alter.)

title: Fighters Straight Ahead
lore: Sometimes a swarm of starfighters can look more imposing than it really is. Mostly though, it's just best to avoid them altogether.
gameText: Deploy on table. Your Force generation is +1 at systems you control. Opponent's non-unique starfighters are deploy +1 (or +2 to a system you occupy). (Immune to Alter.)

title: Naboo Occupation
lore: Battle droid armies require less credits to maintain than the average soldier. Trade Federation tactics are designed to take advantage of these numbers.
gameText: Deploy on table. During your draw phase, may use 3 Force: until end of next turn, opponent generates no Force at Naboo sites you control with a battle droid. Place Effect in Lost Pile if you have no battle droids on Naboo. (Immune to Alter.)

title: Open Fire!
lore: When given the attack coordinates, AAT weaponry can be programmed to track and fire automatically for maximum destruction.
gameText: Deploy on your AAT. Once during your control phase may use 3 Force to fire your AAT Laser Cannon on this AAT for free.

title: 2X-3KPR (Tooex)
lore: Simple maintenance and diagnostics droid. Activates alarm sensors, security lighting and power fences on remote installations. KPR servant droids built by Lerrimore Droids.
gameText: Where present under 'nighttime conditions,' each of your Rebels and aliens at same planet site are power +2, and also have immunity to attrition < 3 if a Hydroponics Station is present.

title: General Dodonna
lore: Skilled tactician and natural leader. Planned attack on Death Star after analyzing technical readouts provided by Princess Leia. Star Destroyer captain during Old Republic.
gameText: Increases Rebel Planners by 1, doubles if at same site. May use 1 Force to cancel Wrong Turn. Each Rebel present with him at a Yavin 4 site is power +1.

title: Old Ben
lore: 'That old man's just a crazy wizard.' Obi-Wan lived in Tatooine's deserts for years...ready for the right moment to act.
gameText: Use 1 Force if any of your characters (except Obi-Wan) was just forfeited from a Tatooine site. Mysterious 'crazy wizard' steps in and revives (returns from Lost Pile) that character back to same site.

title: On The Edge
lore: Luke and Leia nearly fell over the retracted bridge across the Death Star's central core while trying to elude stormtroopers. They were soon trapped on the precipice.
gameText: Use 1 Force and target one Rebel (on table) of ability > 2. Choose a number from 1 to 6. You may retrieve that amount from your Lost Pile if you now draw destiny > chosen number. If you fail, Rebel is lost.

title: Out Of Nowhere
lore: Black market sensor-stealth arrays can be used to hide starships from enemy sensor scans. Stellar interference can naturally shield a starship for surprise attacks.
gameText: If opponent just initiated a battle at a system or sector where you have a starship with maneuver > 3, use 1 Force to add one battle destiny.

title: Panic
lore: Cornered by Imperial troops, Han's gambler reflexes led him to do what comes naturally - attack! Surprise assaults work...sometimes.
gameText: If opponent just initiated a battle where opponent has more than double your power, reveal up to 3 cards from your Reserve Deck. Of those 3, deploy anywhere (for free) any characters, starships, vehicles, devices or weapons. Any others are lost.

title: Radar Scanner
lore: Sensor on Luke's landspeeder. Many possible settings. Can scan for life forms, movement or concentrations of metal. Used for traffic control on settled worlds.
gameText: If you have at least one vehicle or starship on table, use 1 Force to glance at the cards in the opponent's hand for 10 seconds. You may move each Jawa (except Dathcha) and Tusken Raider you find there to opponent's Used Pile.

title: Rebel Barrier
lore: While being chased through the Death Star, Luke and Leia disabled the blast doors behind them in order to slow down pursuing stormtroopers.
gameText: Use 1 Force to prevent any character or starship just deployed by the opponent from battling or moving for the remainder of this turn.

title: Rebel Reinforcements
lore: Rebels rely on hidden 'cells' of undercover operatives. Striking from hidden bases, troops or starfighters can arrive in a battle zone at any time.
gameText: If opponent outnumbers you in total characters and starships on table, use 1 Force to draw destiny. That number of Rebel Troopers and/or Y-Wings, may be retrieved from Lost Pile.

title: Return Of A Jedi
lore: 'Where did you dig up that old fossil?' 'I don't think he exists anymore.' 'Surely he must be dead by now.' 'I can't believe he's gone.' 'Oh, he's not dead, not yet.' Obi's back!
gameText: If Obi-Wan is lost, use 1 Force to retrieve him from the Lost Pile. OR Use 3 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take Obi-Wan into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.

title: Scomp Link Access
lore: A computer connection access port used mainly by droids to plug into database networks and locate information, evaluate threats, execute diagnostics or perform maintenance.
gameText: If one of your 'R' unit droids is at any Scomp link, you may: glance at the cards in any Reserve Deck for 20 seconds. Shuffle, cut and replace. OR If also at a Death Star site, cancel We're All Gonna Be A Lot Thinner or Boring Conversation Anyway.

title: Sense
lore: Users of the Force can sense impending danger by feeling the way the Force flows in others. Cataclysmic events can be sensed (as when Obi-Wan felt Alderaan's destruction).
gameText: Cancel one Interrupt (or one 'react') by drawing a destiny < ability of your highest-ability character on table. OR Cancel one Alter card just played.

title: Han Solo
lore: Smuggler, gambler and 'freelance law-bender.' Crafty Corellian pirate. Rebel hero. Owns Millennium Falcon. Co-pilot Chewbacca promised him 'life-debt.' Has bounty on head.
gameText: Once during battle, may use 1 Force to cancel and re-draw your just drawn destiny. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Falcon, also adds 2 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

title: Skywalkers
lore: Luke and Leia escaped to an unused portion of the Death Star, evading security checkpoints. At a retracted bridge, they swung across on a grappling line through enemy fire.
gameText: If Luke and Leia are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny OR Cancel Imperial Barrier or Wrong Turn or Retract The Bridge.

title: Solo Han
lore: As a smuggler, Solo must always be alert for trouble, even when appearing relaxed. Bounty hunters are eager to claim the price on the Corellian pirate's head.
gameText: If Han is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny. OR If your alien is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny.

title: Spaceport Speeders
lore: Spaceport Speeders buys, trades and sells floaters. Wioslea is known as a shrewd bargainer. Luke got 2,000 credits for his X-24 speeder.
gameText: Sell one of your vehicles or droids at Mos Eisley or same site as Wioslea. Draw two destiny (three destiny if vehicle is Luke's X-34 Landspeeder). The total is the 'offer,' which you must accept. Activate that much Force; then vehicle or droid is lost.

title: Surprise Assault
lore: Imperial troops with strict orders are often caught off-guard by innovative Rebel ambushes, sneak attacks, or sabotage efforts.
gameText: Use 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at one location. Draw one destiny for each character, starship and vehicle the opponent has present. Compare your destiny total to opponent's power total. Player with lowest total loses Force equal to the difference.

title: Thank The Maker
lore: Reference to 'One Who Creates,' used by droids in an almost religious way. C-3PO used phrase upon getting a much-needed cleansing oil bath.
gameText: Use 1 Force during opponent's control phase if you have a droid on the table and were drained of at least 5 Force. Draw destiny. That number of cards are randomly selected and retrieved from your Lost Pile.

title: The Bith Shuffle
lore: Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes play at the Cantina with a distinctive rocking motion. When Luke arrived, they were playing one of their favorite songs, 'Mad About Me.'
gameText: Shuffle any player's Reserve Deck or Lost Pile or Used Pile.

title: The Force Is Strong With This One
lore: Luke's piloting skills and Force abilities made his X-wing a difficult target for Darth Vader as they raced down the Death Star trench.
gameText: If Luke and an Imperial with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle, you may add one battle destiny (add 2 if Imperial is Vader).

title: This Is All Your Fault
lore: 'We seem to be made to suffer. It's our lot in life.'
gameText: Lose a droid to cancel all attrition against you at same site this turn. OR Re-target an opponent's weapon to one of your droids at same site as target. If droid is 'hit', use original target's forfeit number.

title: Utinni!
lore: Jawa trade language word for 'Come here!' Jawas work communally and scavenge for equipment.
gameText: If one of your Jawas is at the same location as any Utinni Effect, 'steal' that Utinni Effect into your hand, to use or lose as your own. OR Cancel any Interrupt or Effect with 'Jawa' in the card name.

title: Warrior's Courage
lore: Each Rebel soldier is driven by bravery and a belief in the Rebel Alliance's ideal of freedom. Courageous and quick-thinking Rebels often defeat Imperial legions.
gameText: If your warrior is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny. OR If Leia is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny.

title: Jawa
lore: Pesky scavenger species. One meter tall. Trade language nearly unintelligible...unless Jawas wish to be understood. Sometimes build massive stone fortresses.
gameText: *To deploy, requires 1 Force from each players' Force Pile. Cannot deploy otherwise. Deploy only on Tatooine, but may move elsewhere.

title: We're Doomed
lore: Threepio's many misadventures often threatened his continued operation. The luckless protocol droid developed a healthy sense of cynicism, and a keen grasp of the obvious.
gameText: If you have less than 15 Life Force, play during opponent's control phase. For remainder of turn, each time you must lose Force, the loss is cut in half (round up). If R2-D2 or C-3PO on table, round down.

title: Alderaan
locationDarkSideGameText: If you control, Force drain +1 here.
locationLightSideGameText: Subtract 1 from each of opponent's battle destiny draws here.

title: Dantooine
locationDarkSideGameText: If you control, Force drain +1 here.
locationLightSideGameText: Your capital starships deploy -2 and your starfighters deploy -1 here.

title: Death Star: Detention Block Control Room
locationLightSideGameText: If you control, Force Drain +1 here and all imprisoned characters on Death Star are released.

title: Death Star: Docking Bay 327
locationDarkSideGameText: Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.
locationLightSideGameText: Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.

title: Death Star: Trash Compactor
locationLightSideGameText: You may deploy here without presence. If you control, Force drain +1 here.

title: Kessel
locationDarkSideGameText: If you control, Kessel Run is prevented (canceled).
locationLightSideGameText: If you control, Force drain +1 here.

title: Tatooine
locationDarkSideGameText: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Tatooine sites.
locationLightSideGameText: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Tatooine sites.

title: Tatooine: Cantina
locationDarkSideGameText: Your aliens here, except Tusken Raiders, are each forfeit +1.
locationLightSideGameText: Your aliens here are each power +1.

title: Tatooine: Docking Bay 94
locationDarkSideGameText: Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.
locationLightSideGameText: Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.

title: Jek Porkins
lore: Piloted Red 6 at Battle of Yavin. Specializes in strafing runs. Served in Tierfon Yellow Aces squadron at Tierfon Rebel Outpost. Free trader from Bestine system.
gameText: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 6, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

title: Tatooine: Dune Sea
locationDarkSideGameText: Total ability of 6 or more required for you to draw battle destiny here.

title: Tatooine: Jawa Camp
locationLightSideGameText: Your Jawas deploy here for 1 Force from you only, for free if Sandcrawler present.

title: Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm
locationDarkSideGameText: Add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws here.
locationLightSideGameText: Beru Lars and Luke deploy -1 here.

title: Tatooine: Mos Eisley
locationLightSideGameText: During your control phase, you may move free from here directly to Cantina (or vice versa).

title: Tatooine: Obi-Wan's Hut
locationDarkSideGameText: If you control, Force drain +1 here.
locationLightSideGameText: Obi-Wan is deploy -3 here.

title: Yavin 4
locationDarkSideGameText: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Yavin 4 sites.
locationLightSideGameText: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Yavin 4 sites.

title: Yavin 4: Docking Bay
locationDarkSideGameText: Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.
locationLightSideGameText: Your docking bay transit from here is free.

title: Yavin 4: Jungle
locationDarkSideGameText: If you control, Force drain +1 here.
locationLightSideGameText: A Rebel alone here battles at power +2 and is immune to attrition.

title: Yavin 4: Massassi Throne Room
locationDarkSideGameText: If you control, Force drain +1 here.
locationLightSideGameText: If this is your starting location, Light Side goes first in game.

title: Yavin 4: Massassi War Room
locationDarkSideGameText: If you initiate a battle here, add one battle destiny.
locationLightSideGameText: If you control, with a leader here, all Stormtroopers and TIEs on table are forfeit -1.

title: Kabe
lore: Young female Chadra-Fan. Thief. Guardian is Muftak. Abandoned on Tatooine by slavers. Loves intoxicating juri juice. Once robbed Jabba the Hutt's dwelling in Mos Eisley.
gameText: During your control phase, may target one opponent's weapon or device at same site. Draw destiny. If destiny < target's destiny number, Kabe 'steals' device to use, or weapon to hold and transfer (for free) to a warrior at same site.

title: Corellian Corvette
lore: Multi-purpose Rebel Blockade Runner. Modular interior designed for troop or cargo transport. 150 meters long. Used by Rebels, pirates, corporations and the Empire.
gameText: May add 3 pilots, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

title: Gold 1
lore: Lead fighter of Gold Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Designated Specter 1 at Renforra Base.
gameText: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Must have pilot aboard to use power, maneuver or hyperspeed.

title: Gold 5
lore: Flown by the veteran Rebel fighter pilot Pops during the Battle of Yavin. He personally supervised all repairs and maintenance.
gameText: May add 2 pilots or passengers, and 1 astromech. Must have pilot aboard to use power, maneuver or hyperspeed.

title: Millennium Falcon
lore: Modified YT-1300 freighter. Owned by Lando Calrissian until won by Han in a sabacc game. 26.7 meters long. 'She may not look like much, but she's got it where it counts.'
gameText: May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Immune to attrition < 5 if Han, Chewie or Lando piloting. Has ship-docking capability. Must have pilot aboard to use power, maneuver or hyperspeed.

title: Red 1
lore: Lead fighter of Red Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Garven Dreis. Also served at main Rebel base on Dantooine.
gameText: May add 1 pilot. Must have pilot aboard to use power, maneuver or hyperspeed.

title: Red 3
lore: Biggs Darklighter's fighter at Battle of Yavin. Part of Ecliptic Evaders squadron near Sullust until transferred to Yavin Base.
gameText: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. Must have pilot aboard to use power, maneuver or hyperspeed.

title: X-wing
lore: Model T-65 by Incom Corporation. Delivered to Alliance by defecting design team. 12.5 meters long. Wings deploy in an 'X' position for better weapons coverage.
gameText: Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

title: Y-wing
lore: Rugged Rebel Alliance fighter. BTL-S3 has room for a second pilot to assist weapons operations. 16 meters long. Built by Koensayr.
gameText: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

title: Lift Tube
lore: System of enclosed high-speed vertical and horizontal transport cylinders. Used in space stations, large starships, Death Stars, etc.
gameText: May carry 4 passengers. Deploy and move only at interior mobile sites. May move without presence aboard. Also, may move as a 'react' only to a battle or Force drain (if within range).

title: Luke's X-34 Landspeeder
lore: Skywalker's SoroSuub. Common open air transport. Top speed 250 km per hour. Repulsorlift drive keeps it suspended one meter above ground, even when parked.
gameText: May add 1 driver and 2 passengers. Moves free if Luke aboard. May move as a 'react.'

title: Kal'Falnl C'ndros
lore: A female Quor'sav, a warm-blooded, avian/monotreme species. 3.5 meters tall. Over-protective mother. Freelance pilot. Has custom-built ship with tall corridors. Lays eggs.
gameText: When in a battle, if both players draw only one battle destiny and yours is higher, reduces opponent's destiny to zero. Landspeed = 3. Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. May not deploy to or board starfighters or enclosed vehicles.

title: Sandcrawler
lore: Warren-like enclosed homes for Jawa tribes. Protects against Tatooine predators. Originally mining vehicles. Jawas claimed them when mines abandoned. No two look alike.
gameText: Deploys only to a Tatooine site. May add 1 driver and 7 passengers. Cannot move to mobile sites. Adds 1 to forfeit of each Jawa at same exterior site.

title: SoroSuub V-35 Landspeeder
lore: Typical old model Courier landspeeder such as the one used by Lars family for trips to Anchorhead. Has cargo compartment. Enclosed seating.
gameText: May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. Moves free if Owen Lars, Beru Lars or Luke aboard. May move as a 'react'.

title: Blaster
lore: A Merr-Sonn Model 44 blaster pistol. Uses power packagedProduct and high-energy blaster gases to shoot bolts of explosive coherent light energy.
gameText: Use 1 Force to deploy on your warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.

title: Blaster Rifle
lore: BlasTech E-11 blaster rifle. Standard issue for Imperial forces. So numerous that many have been stolen by Rebels. Extendable stock. Carries energy for 100 shots.
gameText: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.

title: Han's Heavy Blaster Pistol
lore: BlasTech DL-44 heavy pistol. Short range, but relatively powerful. Carries energy for 25 shots. Illegal or restricted on most systems.
gameText: Use 1 Force to deploy on Han, or 3 on your warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value. If hit by Han, target's forfeit = 0.

title: Jedi Lightsaber
lore: Elegant sword of pure energy. 'This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster. A lightsaber can be dangerous to an unskilled user.'
gameText: Use X Force to deploy on your warrior where X = (7 - warrior's ability). May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature by using X Force. Draw two destiny. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

title: Leia's Sporting Blaster
lore: Defender sporting blaster, made by Drearian Defense Conglomerate. Intended for personal defense or small-game hunting. Short range. Low power. Carries energy for 50 shots.
gameText: Use 1 Force to deploy on Leia, or 2 on your warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny -1 > defense value. If hit by Leia, target's forfeit = 0.

title: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber
lore: 'An elegant weapon for a more civilized time.' Miniaturized power cell. Uses rare crystals to focus the lightblade. This lightsaber was personally built by Obi-Wan.
gameText: Deploy on Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.

title: Proton Torpedoes
lore: Powerful ballistic projectiles. Carries proton-scattering energy warheads. Short range. Pierces energy shields, but blocked by particle shields.
gameText: Use 1 Force to deploy on your X-wing, Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.

title: Quad Laser Cannon
lore: Starship blaster, often slung in turret mounts to take advantage of light weight and quick targeting motions. Installed on many starships including the Millennium Falcon.
gameText: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Corellian Corvette or Falcon. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a starfighter. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

title: Leesub Sirln
lore: Leesub is a Qiraash (near-human). Enslaved as child. Limited precognition. Selected by Imperial High Inquisitor Tremayne as Force adept. Escaped and hiding in Mos Eisley.
gameText: Once each turn during your control phase, may use 1 Force to guess a card type and point to a card in opponent's hand. Card must be shown. If guessed correctly, card is lost.

title: Tagge Seeker
lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
gameText: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Tagge (or warrior) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an 'all cards' situation). Seeker is also lost.

title: Tarkin Seeker
lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
gameText: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Tarkin (or alien) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an 'all cards' situation). Seeker is also lost.

title: Timer Mine
lore: A timer-activated explosive device designed to be placed by a mining droid. Typically used in ore and spice mines for demolition. Also has many military applications.
gameText: Deploy on opponent's side at same site as one of your mining droids. 'Explodes' at beginning of your next turn. Draw destiny. That number of opponent's characters there are immediately lost (owner's choice). Timer Mine is also lost.

title: 5D6-RA-7 (Fivedesix)
lore: Aide to Admiral Motti's staff. Foul-tempered and vindictive. Feared by other droids. A spy for the ISB. Secretly investigates Imperial officers whose loyalties are in question.
gameText: Power +1 if at same site as Motti or Yularen. Deploy +1 for all opponent's droids (and your 'mouse' droids) at same location. Immune to attrition during 'nighttime conditions.'

title: Admiral Motti
lore: Senior Navy Commander of Death Star. Believes in technology. Ridiculed the Force. Ambitious leader. Promoted due to support of New Order, not military skills. Hates Vader.
gameText: Deploys -2 if at least two Imperial starships on table. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Subtracts 1 from forfeit of Rebel pilots at same system.

title: Chief Bast
lore: Aide to Grand Moff Tarkin. Rarely underestimates enemies. Learned cunning and patience hunting big game as a youth.
gameText: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Power +1 if at same site as Tarkin. If a battle was just initiated at a system where Bast is present with your non-droid character aboard a starship, may 'evacuate' (relocate) both to a related site.

title: Colonel Wullf Yularen
lore: Imperial Security Bureau (ISB) officer assigned to brief Tarkin. Also ordered to ensure absolute loyalty to the Emperor. Leader. Will stop at nothing to fulfill the Emperor's will.
gameText: Power +1 if at the same site with Tarkin, Chief Bast or General Dodonna.

title: Commander Praji
lore: Vader's aide on the Devastator. Personally supervised search for Death Star plans on Tatooine by Vader's order. Was graduated with honors from Imperial Navy Academy on Carida.
gameText: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Devastator, also adds 1 to hyperspeed. Where present, cancels game text of C-3PO or R2-D2.

title: Darth Vader
lore: Dark Lord of the Sith. Servant of Emperor's. Encased in armor with cybernetic life support. Student of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Was the best starpilot in the galaxy. Cunning warrior.
gameText: When in battle, adds 1 to each of your battle destiny draws. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots (or 4 to power and 3 to maneuver if Vader's Custom TIE). Immune to attrition < 5.

title: Dathcha
lore: Jawa adventurer and trader. Famous for taunting a krayt dragon and escaping to tell the tale. Wants to leave Tatooine to explore the galaxy.
gameText: To deploy, requires 2 Force from each players' Force Pile. Cannot deploy otherwise. Deploy only on Tatooine, but may move elsewhere. Power +2 at non-Tatooine sites.

title: Leia Organa
lore: Strong-willed princess from Alderaan. Youngest Imperial Senator ever. Used diplomatic immunity to spy for Rebels. Led relief effort on Ralltir. Natural leader.
gameText: Adds 1 to power of each Rebel present with her at a Death Star site. 'Diplomatic' immunity to attrition < 2.

title: Death Star Trooper
lore: Elite soldiers trained in combat techniques and weapons skills. Devin Cant augmented security personnel guarding Princess Leia in Detention Block AA-23.
gameText: Deploy only on Death Star, but may move elsewhere. Power -1 at a site other than a Death Star site.

title: Djas Puhr
lore: Male Sakiyan, a race often employed as assassins. Bounty hunter. Incredible infrared peripheral vision. Has excellent aural and olfactory senses. Often tracks by scent.
gameText: Power +1 for each [Dark Side Force] present, +2 under 'nighttime conditions.' Immune to attrition < 3.

title: Dr. Evazan
lore: Thug. Smuggler. Twisted 'doctor'. Disfigured by blaster. Has death sentence in over 12 systems. Notorious partner of Ponda Baba. Aliases: Dr. Cornelius and Rooboo.
gameText: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. The not-so-good doctor may 'operate' on any other character present that was just 'hit' or just Disarmed; 'patient' is lost.

title: DS-61-2
lore: Vader's left wingman. Flies Black 2. Specially trained pilot held in reserve for mission with Vader. Nicknamed 'Mauler Mithel.'
gameText: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 2, also adds 1 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

title: DS-61-3
lore: Vader's right wingman. Flies Black 3. Reputation for ferocity in combat. Corellian pilot with excellent skills. Nicknamed 'Backstabber.'
gameText: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 3, also adds 1 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

title: EG-6 (Eegee-Six)
lore: Ambulatory power generator made by Veril Line Systems to support equipment and vehicles. Slow-witted. This EG unit is memory-wiped and doesn't know its name or serial number.
gameText: Adds 1 to power of each of your droids present, except power droids. *Destiny equals zero, but if drawn as a battle destiny where you have less power than opponent, your total power present is doubled (once per battle).

title: Feltipern Trevagg
lore: Corrupt tax collector. A male Gotal. Bounty hunter. Once sought a bounty on Obi-Wan. Has limited sensing ability to droid emanations. Romanced M'iiyoom Onith.
gameText: While no droid present with Trevagg, to initiate battles at same location as Trevagg, player must use X Force, where X = total number of [Dark Side Force] and [Light Side Force] present.

title: Garindan
lore: Long-nosed, male Kubaz from Kubindi. Spy. Squealed on Obi-Wan and Luke outside Docking Bay 94. Works for Jabba the Hutt or the highest bidder. Not particularly brave.
gameText: When at same location as a Rebel of ability > 2, deploy -1 there for any Imperials, and during your move phase, Imperials at an adjacent site may move there for free.

title: General Tagge
lore: Oversees defense operations of Death Star. Outstanding tactician. No-nonsense leader. Member of House of Tagge, a powerful noble family and corporate conglomerate.
gameText: Tagge's forfeit +1 for each Imperial trooper, of any kind, present with him at a site.

title: Grand Moff Tarkin
lore: Leader. Governor of Outer Rim Territories. Commanded Death Star. Helped disband Imperial Senate. Defined doctrine of rule by fear. Plotted to use Death Star against Emperor.
gameText: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When with Vader in a battle, once per battle may cancel one opponent's destiny just drawn.

title: LIN-V8K (Elleyein-Veeatekay)
lore: Armored military droid which specializes in laying explosive mines. Originally intended to set charges inside ore and spice mines, but has also been converted for military use.
gameText: At any time during your turn, may use 1 Force to 'defuse' (lose) any one mine at same site.

title: Imperial Pilot
lore: Among the Empire's best pilots. Loyal and fearless. Use superior numbers to overwhelm opponents. Trained under combat conditions. Wear sealed, high-gravity flight suits.
gameText: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots.

title: Imperial Trooper Guard
lore: Elite soldiers trained in combat techniques and weapons skills. Death Star trooper Tajis Durmin is typical of those assigned to guard key areas of the Death Star.
gameText: Power +4 when defending a battle. Cannot move.

title: Jawa
lore: Small, rodent-like scavenger species. Refurbish and sell droids. Nest in sandcrawlers. Considered to be pests by most species.
gameText: To deploy, requires 1 Force from each players' Force Pile. Cannot deploy otherwise. Deploy only on Tatooine, but may move elsewhere.

title: Kitik Keed'kak
lore: A female insectoid Yam'rii. Very strong and easily angered. Known for stealth, but also has good technological aptitude. Meat eater. Loves eggs.
gameText: Immediately lost if at same site as overprotective mother, Kal'Faln C'ndros. Cannot board starfighters or enclosed vehicles.

title: Labria
lore: Information broker. Spy. Devaronian males instinctively have 'wanderlust.' Frustrated that he must be reclusive due to shady past. Suffers from prejudice due to devilish appearance.
gameText: Once each turn, during your control phase, you may reveal the top card of your Reserve Deck to both players. If it is a vehicle or starship, card is immediately lost. Otherwise, return it to the top of your Reserve Deck, Force Pile or Used Pile.

title: Lieutenant Tanbris
lore: Former fighter pilot grounded after injury. Tactical officer aboard Death Star. Competent strategist. Specializes in directing Imperial starfighters.
gameText: Deploy -1 for starship weapons of any starship he pilots. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Subtracts 1 from maneuver of any starfighter he pilots.

title: LIN-V8M (Elleyein-Veeateemm)
lore: Armored military droid which specializes in laying explosive mines. Originally intended to set charges inside ore and spice mines, but has also been converted for military use.
gameText: At any time during your turn, may use 1 Force to 'defuse' (lose) any one mine at same site.

title: M'iiyoom Onith
lore: Female H'nemthe, a species whose females ritually kill their mates. Stranded on Tatooine due to questionable passage tax. Razor-sharp tongue. M'iiyoom means, 'nightlilly'.
gameText: Once during each of your control phases, may reveal opponent's hand by using X Force, where X = number of cards in opponent's hand. All unique (•) male Rebels and unique (•) male aliens there are lost.

title: Myo
lore: A regenerating, primitive, violent, desert dwelling, fearless, mercenary-joining, Lirin Car'n-befriending, cyclopian Abyssin from Byss. Calling him 'monoc' will start a fight.
gameText: Power +1 if present with Lirin Car'n or any bounty hunter. If lost or forfeited as a result of a battle, Myo 'regenerates' (place on top of your Used Pile).

title: Luke Skywalker
lore: Son of Anakin Skywalker. Student of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Honed piloting skills while bullseyeing womp rats in Beggar's Canyon aboard T-16 skyhopper.
gameText: While Luke is not on Tatooine your total Force generation is +1. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 5, also adds 2 to maneuver. Immune to attrition < 3.

title: Ponda Baba
lore: A male Quara (or fingered Aqualish). Thug, smuggler and partner of Dr. Evazan. Has a poor quality cybernetic arm replacement.
gameText: Power +3 when battling at same site as Dr. Evazan, unless opponent has a lightsaber present. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots.

title: Prophetess
lore: Renowned female psychic. Predictor of doom. Agent for Governor Aryon of Tatooine. Tailed Jabba and his thugs to Docking Bay 94 when they confronted Han Solo.
gameText: If you initiate a battle where present, you must predict the winner before the battle starts. If correct, randomly retrieve one lost card. If incorrect, lose 1 Force. Immune to attrition < 3.

title: R1-G4 (Arone-Geefour)
lore: Typical of the old model astromechs still used on capital starships and large freighters. Has armored Mark II reactor drone shell. R1-G4 was abandoned after owner was captured.
gameText: When aboard a capital starship, adds 1 to power and hyperspeed, and that starship is immune to attrition < 3. Too large to go aboard a starfighter.

title: R4-M9 (Arfour-Emmnine)
lore: Typical multiple-use droid. Controls and repairs vehicles and computers. R4-M9 was once used by the Empire to pull data from Tantive IV's computer banks.
gameText: While aboard a non-creature vehicle, adds 1 to power, maneuver and landspeed. May drive transport vehicles.

title: Stormtrooper
lore: One of the countless elite shock troops totally loyal to the Emperor. Unquestioningly follows orders. Willing to sacrifice their lives to accomplish a mission. First-strike force.
gameText: Deploys free to same site as one of your Imperials with ability > 2.

title: Tonnika Sisters
lore: Twins. Thieves. Con artists. Spies. Swindlers. Double agents. Brea and Senni use their natural charm to sway the unwary on the fringe of society.
gameText: Twice during each of your control phases, may use 2 Force to draw 2 destiny for 2 chances at a destiny = 2. If successful, may steal or destroy up to 2 weapons or 2 devices present.

title: Tusken Raider
lore: 'Sand People.' Ride banthas. Wield gaderffi (gaffi) sticks. Wear eye protectors and breath masks. Violent, nomadic, desert survival experts. 'Urrrg! Ur Ur Uur!'
gameText: Deploys only on Tatooine. Power +1 if another non-unique Tusken Raider present. If you have four or more non-unique Tusken Raiders present, your total power here is +2.

title: WED15-I662 'Treadwell' Droid
lore: Standard treadwell droid. This one, also known as 'Eyesixsixtoo', is typical of the thousands of droids which repair and maintain heavy machinery and starfighters.
gameText: Adds immunity to attrition < 2 to all your vehicles and droids at same location. Also, if 'treadwell' droid is at a docking bay, adds immunity to attrition < 3 to all your starfighters at the related system and related sectors.

title: Wuher
lore: Gruff, surly, no-blasters-allowed bartender. Hates droids. 'We don't serve their kind here.' Wants to concoct the perfect drink for Jabba so he can work as his personal bartender.
gameText: If at the beginning of your control phase any weapons or droids are present at same site, all of them are lost. If in the Cantina, all weapons and droids there are immediately lost.

title: Blaster Scope
lore: The effectiveness of a blaster can sometimes be enhanced through an electronic targeting scope mounted on top, especially for long range targets.
gameText: Deploy on [Dagobah] 4-LOM's Concussion Rifle or on your blaster weapon card. Allows that weapon to target at an adjacent site.

title: Beru Lars
lore: Wife of Owen Lars and guardian of Luke Skywalker. Quietly lobbied Owen to allow Luke to attend Academy. Maintains Lars' farm hydroponics labs.
gameText: Forfeit +2 when at same site as Owen Lars or a Hydroponics Station. If lost from table during opponent's turn, Luke is power +3 until the end of your next turn.

title: Momaw Nadon
lore: Male Ithorian, from a tree-loving race derogatorily nicknamed, 'Hammerheads.' Master of animal husbandry and horticulture. Former herd ship leader. Rebel spy.
gameText: During your control phase, may snare (steal) one Bantha, Dewback, Wampa, Rancor, Bubo, or Dragonsnake present at same site.

title: Caller
lore: Hand-held device that commands restraining bolt. Each caller can be keyed to a specific bolt. Used throughout the galaxy. Also called 'owners.'
gameText: Deploy on Imperial or Jawa. During your control phase, may steal one droid at same site if it is controlled by a Restraining Bolt. After droid is stolen, Restraining Bolt returns to owner's hand.

title: Comlink
lore: Hand-held communication device. Military comlinks have scrambling and variable frequency programming for secure communication during battles or emergencies.
gameText: Use 1 Force to deploy on any character. If opponent has just initiated a battle or Force drain at Comlink's location or an adjacent site, you may 'react' by deploying cards (at normal use of the Force) to that battle or Force drain location.

title: Droid Detector
lore: To keep out the mechanicals he so detested, Wuher installed an automatic droid detector at the entrance to the Mos Eisley Cantina.
gameText: Deploy at any interior site. Cannot be moved. Droids may not deploy to same site. Following the turn this device is deployed, all droids present are lost at end of any turn.

title: Fusion Generator Supply Tanks
lore: Installed at many facilities throughout the Empire to provide power to the Imperial spacefleet. Supplies starships with energy necessary for sublight and hyperspace travel.
gameText: Deploy on your starship at a system or sector where a related docking bay is on table. Adds 1 to hyperspeed, power and maneuver.

title: Observation Holocam
lore: Remote surveillance viewers with droid controllers supplement security. Can activate alarms and automated weapons when needed, bringing help to endangered locations.
gameText: Deploy on a site. Adds 1 to the total weapon destiny of each of your automated weapons at same and adjacent sites. During battle, may add the power of one of your characters at an adjacent site you control to your total.

title: Restraining Bolt
lore: Affixed to droid's special recessed socket by using a fusion welder. Bolts can override a droid's circuits, freezing it in place if the droid tries to disobey orders.
gameText: Deploy on any droid at any site. Droid cannot move and cannot utilize its 'game text.' During your deploy phase, Restraining Bolt may be transferred (for free) to another droid at same site.

title: Stormtrooper Backpack
lore: Standard-issue Imperial equipment with full survival and encampment gear, plus ammunition and food for an extended deployment. Makes each trooper self-sufficient.
gameText: Deploy on your trooper. May use any number of weapons and devices. Trooper is immune to attrition < 3 when at a planet site.

title: Stormtrooper Utility Belt
lore: Standard Imperial issue for stormtroopers. Contains grappling hook, rope, and other miscellaneous emergency tools. Rebels have been known to steal and use them.
gameText: Use 1 Force to deploy on any Imperial or alien. Character's power and forfeit are +1. If on Death Star, power and forfeit are +2.

title: A Disturbance In The Force
lore: The destruction of Alderaan caused a great disturbance in the Force '...as if millions of voices suddenly cried out in terror and were suddenly silenced.'
gameText: Once per game, during your deploy phase, 'insert' (face down) into opponent's Reserve Deck; reshuffle. When effect reaches top it is immediately lost, but opponent may not activate any more Force that turn. (Immune to Alter.)

title: Baniss Keeg
lore: Duros are famous spacers and starship engineers. Many are forced to work for the Empire. Some, like Baniss Keeg, train pilots for deep space missions.
gameText: Deploy on your non-pilot character (except droids) to give that character [Pilot] skill.  Adds 2 to power of anything that character pilots. OR Deploy on your pilot. Adds 1 to power of anything that character pilots. (Immune to Alter.)

title: Obi-Wan Kenobi
lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.
gameText: When a battle was just initiated where present, may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's character of ability = 1 present to move away (for free), or that character is lost. Immune to attrition < 5.

title: Blast Door Controls
lore: Panels control blast doors and key security lock-downs during alerts. Luke destroyed one, locking Imperial forces out of Hangar Bay 327.
gameText: Deploy on your side of table. Cancels: Into The Garbage Chute, Flyboy; Narrow Escape; Blast The Door, Kid!; and Rebel Barrier.

title: Blaster Rack
lore: Imperial facilities like the Death Star and garrison bases have blaster racks at key locations to equip soldiers with weapons like blaster rifles and thermal detonators.
gameText: Deploy on your side of table. At any time, you may transfer one of your character weapons from any site to the Blaster Rack. During your deploy phase, weapon may be transferred to your character on table for an expenditure of Force equal to the weapon's deploy cost.

title: Dark Hours
lore: After surviving Tarkin's extortion, kidnapping, threats of execution and the assault of the Interceptor droid, Princess Leia was asleep when her rescuers came.
gameText: Deploy on a site under 'nighttime conditions.' One at a time, target each non-droid character here and draw destiny. If destiny > ability, character 'sleeps' (power, forfeit and ability = 0, 'game text' is canceled, and may not pilot, drive, or move). At the end of your next turn, lose effect and restore targets (if on table) to normal.

title: Death Star Sentry
lore: Death Star troopers on sentry duty observe and direct incoming starships and monitor other critical sites. They perform sensor scans for life forms and weapons.
gameText: Use 2 Force to deploy on any Death Star site. Declare one of the following to affect that site and adjacent sites while 'sentry' present: Opponent's deploy +1. OR Opponent's ability required for battle destiny +1. OR Your total power +1.

title: Disarmed
lore: C-3PO's arm was pulled off by attacking Tusken Raiders. 'I don't think I can make it. You go on, Master Luke...I'm done for.'
gameText: If both players have a character with a weapon present at same site, deploy on that opponent's character during any control phase. Character loses all weapons, is power -1 and may no longer carry weapons. (Immune to Alter.)

title: Expand The Empire
lore: The Emperor disbanded the Imperial Senate 'for the duration of the emergency,' seizing absolute power. He planned to extend rule by terrorizing planets into submission.
gameText: Deploy on any site. 'Expands' your 'game text' for that site to add to your 'game text' at the adjacent sites.

title: Fear Will Keep Them In Line
lore: 'The regional governors now have direct control over their territories. Fear will keep the local systems in line. Fear of this battle station.'
gameText: Deploy on any capital starship. When that starship is at a system or sector you control, your total power is +1 in battles at related sites.

title: I Find Your Lack Of Faith Disturbing
lore: Darth Vader ruthlessly used the Force to strike down enemies and soldiers who displeased him. He could choke victims from afar without touching them.
gameText: Use 1 Force to deploy on one of your Dark Jedi. Opponent's total ability at same location is reduced by 2, unless an opponent's Jedi is also present.

title: I've Lost Artoo!
lore: 'WHAAAAAAAAAOOOOW!'
gameText: Use 1 Force to target a starship's [Nav Computer] or astromech. Draw destiny. If destiny > 1, [Nav Computer] or astromech is lost. If starship's [Nav Computer] is lost, place Effect on starship (may add 1 astromech); otherwise, Effect lost.

title: Jawa Pack
lore: Jawas travel in packs for protection. They use ambush tactics against unwary droids in the canyons of the Jundland Wastes. 'Aeeeyaa!'
gameText: To deploy (on your side of table), requires 3 Force from both players' Force Piles. Cannot deploy otherwise. All your Jawas are forfeit +1.

title: Owen Lars
lore: Guardian of Luke Skywalker. Husband of Beru Lars. Brother of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Farmer of moisture. Disapprover of Luke's desire to leave Tatooine.
gameText: Deploys free at Lars' Moisture Farm. Power +2 if at same site as Beru Lars or a Vaporator. If lost from table during opponent's turn, Luke is power +3 until the end of your next turn.

title: Juri Juice
lore: Popular beverage served in many cantinas and tapcafes. Has intoxicating effect on many species. Favorite drink of Kabe, Chadra-Fan thief of Mos Eisley.
gameText: Deploy on any alien if Cantina, Mos Eisley or Jabba's Sail Barge on table. That alien may not use ability in battles (if Kabe, she also cannot 'steal'). Utinni Effect canceled by moving that alien to one of those sites without 'driving' a vehicle.

title: Ket Maliss
lore: Assassins are highly valued by Jabba the Hutt and other gangsters. Prince Xizor's 'shadow killer,' has unknown but undoubtably lethal business in Mos Eisley.
gameText: Deploy on any non-warrior character (except droids) to give that character [Warrior] skill. OR Deploy on any warrior. That character is power +1. (Immune to Alter.)

title: Lateral Damage
lore: Starships can become damaged in combat and rendered ineffective until they can be repaired and re-outfitted.
gameText: Deploy on any system. Target an opponent's starship. Target's power and forfeit = 0. When target reaches Utinni Effect, target draws one destiny. Utinni Effect canceled if destiny > 2. Otherwise, draw again next move phase, etc.

title: Luke? Luuuuke!
lore: 'All right. I'll be right there, Aunt Beru.'
gameText: Deploy on any Tatooine site. Target any Rebel. Target is power and forfeit -1 (-3 if target is Luke). If Rebel's forfeit reaches zero, Rebel is lost. Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.

title: Macroscan
lore: Electrobinocular view. Readouts list object's true and relative azimuth, elevation and range. Built-in night vision.
gameText: Use 2 Force to deploy near opponent's Reserve Deck. At any time, you may use 1 Force to peek at the top card of that deck. If 'nighttime conditions' exist anywhere on table, you may peek at the top three cards.

title: Molator
lore: Creature in dejarik hologame drawn from Alderaanian mythology. Stories describe molators as powerful, enchanted protectors of Alderaanian kings and queens.
gameText: Deploy on your side of table. For each unit of ability you have present during a battle, you may use 1 Force to raise your total power by 1. Ability used in this way cannot also be used to draw destiny.

title: Organa's Ceremonial Necklace
lore: Necklace worn by Princess Leia during the awards ceremony after the Battle of Yavin. A powerful artifact in the Alderaanian royal family for dozens of generations.
gameText: Deploy on any Yavin 4 site. Target one Imperial. When Imperial reaches target site, 'steal' necklace. Whenever necklace is present during Force drain: add 1 to Force drain and may then pass (for free) to an adjacent site you control (if any), and so on.

title: Presence Of The Force
lore: A location is affected by the history of the events which occur there. The Force '...binds the galaxy together' and has an ebb and flow.
gameText: Deploy on any location to add one [Dark Side Force] and one [Light Side Force].

title: Reactor Terminal
lore: The Death Star has many terminals coupled to the main reactor for power distribution throughout the immense space station.
gameText: Use 1 Force to deploy on your side of table. During your control phase, you may return any cards from your hand to the top of your Used Pile.

title: Send A Detachment Down
lore: Vader sent Imperial stormtroopers to the surface of Tatooine in search of the stolen Death Star plans. 'There'll be no one to stop us this time.'
gameText: Use 2 Force to deploy on any Tatooine site (except docking bay). Target any trooper on Death Star. When target reaches Utinni Effect, attrition +1 against opponent in all Tatooine battles as long as target remains at same site as Utinni Effect.

title: Pops
lore: Piloted Gold 5 at Battle of Yavin. Real name Davish Krail. Veteran pilot. Flew fighters for two decades. Wingman of Gold Leader.
gameText: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 5, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

title: Sunsdown
lore: When the twin suns of Tatooine set. 'Sand People or worse' become a threat, and battles are more dangerous. On Hoth, temperatures drop to deadly extremes.
gameText: Deploy on any planet system to cause 'nighttime conditions' at related sites. During battles there, both sides add one destiny to power only. Spies deploy free to sites under 'nighttime conditions.'

title: Tactical Re-Call
lore: Sophisticated communication equipment hidden in the ruins of the extinct Massassi race is used to coordinate forces and to re-call Rebel officers for debriefing and orders.
gameText: Deploy on any Yavin 4 site immediately after winning a battle elsewhere. Target a warrior involved in that battle. Target's power and forfeit are -2 (-3 if Leia) until target reaches this Utinni Effect (which is then canceled).

title: Wrong Turn
lore: Imperial troopers use tactics to strand and cut off fugitives. Only daring and unpredictable actions gave Luke and Leia a chance to escape.
gameText: Use 3 Force to deploy on opponent's side of table. All opponent's warriors are deploy +1.

title: Your Eyes Can Deceive You
lore: 'With this blast shield down, I can't even see. How am I supposed to fight?'
gameText: Deploy beside either player's Lost Pile. That pile is turned face down. Cards from that player's Life Force may not be viewed when they are lost.

title: Alter
lore: A user of the Force can subjugate the will of others or alter the environment at a distance, as when Vader 'disciplines' those whose lack of faith disturbs him.
gameText: Cancel one Effect (or Utinni Effect) by drawing a destiny < ability of your highest-ability character on table. OR Cancel one Sense card just played.

title: Boring Conversation Anyway
lore: 'Uh...had a slight weapons malfunction. But, uh, everything's perfectly all right now. We're fine. We're all fine here, now, thank you. How are you?'
gameText: Cancel either: Report To Lord Vader, Scomp Link Access, Rebel Planners, Rebel Reinforcements, Gift of the Mentor, Panic, Don't Get Cocky, Skywalkers, Demotion, Combined Attack or Surprise Assault.

title: Charming To The Last
lore: 'You're far too trusting. Dantooine is too remote to make an effective demonstration. But don't worry...We will deal with your Rebel friends soon enough.'
gameText: If Tarkin and a Rebel with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle, you may add one battle destiny (add two destiny if Rebel is Leia).

title: Collateral Damage
lore: Blast vests and helmets with blast shields cannot protect Rebel soldiers from grenades, panel explosions and other combat hazards.
gameText: An accident occurs at the beginning of a battle at any site where opponent has at least two characters and one weapon. Draw destiny. If destiny < number of opponent's characters at that site, one is lost. (Opponent's choice.)

title: Counter Assault
lore: Imperial stormtroopers use tactical training to regroup and mount a surprise counterattack, such as when they halted Han Solo's wild pursuit.
gameText: Use 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at one location. Draw one destiny for each character, starship and vehicle the opponent has present. Compare your destiny total to opponent's power total. Player with lowest total loses Force equal to the difference.

title: Dark Collaboration
lore: Imperial leaders are ruthlessly effective when working together. Tarkin, Motti and Tagge presented a deadly combination as they plotted to 'crush the Rebellion.'
gameText: If Tarkin and either Tagge or Motti are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR Cancel Restricted Deployment or Rebel Barrier.

title: R2-X2 (Artoo-Extoo)
lore: Typical starfighter pilot assistant. Contains ten coordinates for hyperspace jumps. Built-in tools and computer interfaces. R2-X2 was assigned to Red 10 at Yavin Base.
gameText: While aboard any starfighter, adds 1 to power, maneuver, and hyperspeed.

title: Dark Jedi Presence
lore: A Dark Lord's presence motivates Imperial troops. 'See to it personally, Commander.'
gameText: If one of your Dark Jedi is present during any battle, use 1 Force to cause all other Imperials there to battle at double power.

title: Dark Maneuvers
lore: Imperial TIE fighters, while easily damaged, are very fast and agile. Sophisticated tactics are executed to take advantage of Rebel X-wing and Y-wing weaknesses.
gameText: Add 2 to maneuver and 1 to power of any starfighter for the remainder of this turn. If it has hyperdrive, also add 2 to hyperspeed. (Interrupt may even affect the result immediately after a destiny draw targeting the starfighter's maneuver.)

title: Dead Jawa
lore: Many Jawas were killed by stormtroopers searching for R2-D2. They used banthas and gaffi sticks to feign a Tusken Raider attack, but Obi-Wan saw through the ruse.
gameText: If two or more Stormtroopers are present where the opponent has Jawas, target as many Jawas there as desired. Draw destiny. If destiny > the number of Jawas you targeted, they are immediately lost.

title: Elis Helrot
lore: A Givin pilot who can seal his joints to withstand the vacuum of space. Makes slaving and spike runs to Kala'uun. Has made many special modifications to his ship, the Hinthra.
gameText: At any time (except during battle), target any or all of your characters at one site to 'transport' (relocate) to any one other site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.

title: Emergency Deployment
lore: TIE fighters are stored in large racks far above the hangar deck. Catapulted into space by powerful tractor beam generators, TIEs can quickly scramble to engage the enemy.
gameText: If opponent just initiated a battle where opponent has more than double your power, reveal up to 3 cards from your Reserve Deck. Of those 3, deploy anywhere (for free) any characters, starships, vehicles, devices or weapons. Any others are lost.

title: Full Scale Alert
lore: Imperial stormtroopers adopt strict security measures. Excellent communications and sheer numbers can hinder Rebel movement across entire territories.
gameText: Use 2 Force. Draw Destiny. If destiny < number of Stormtroopers on the table, all opponent's movement is blocked for the remainder of this turn (except for smugglers and the starships they are aboard).

title: Gravel Storm
lore: Tatooine's twin suns cause turbulent storms that strike with little or no warning. Strong winds whip rocks through the air with enormous force.
gameText: Strikes at Dune Sea, Jundland Wastes, Beggar's Canyon, Lars' Moisture Farm, Jawa Camp, or Mos Eisley. Target opponent's character present at that site. Draw destiny. Target lost if destiny > ability.

title: I Have You Now
lore: 'Several fighters have broken off from the main group. Come with me.' Darth Vader targets his TIE fighter's fire-linked blaster cannons at the Rebel pilots in the trench.
gameText: If a Dark Jedi and a Rebel with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle, you may add one battle destiny (add two destiny if Rebel is Luke).

title: Imperial Barrier
lore: As is often the case with a hasty plan, a quick heroic escape from the Death Star was temporarily thwarted by the magnetically sealed door in the trash compactor.
gameText: Use 1 Force to prevent any character or starship just deployed by the opponent from battling or moving for the remainder of this turn.

title: R4-E1 (Arfour-Eeone)
lore: One of numerous vehicle computer operation droids, manufactured by Industrial Automation. This unit, R4-E1, is a companion of BoShek. Rambunctious. Fiercely independent.
gameText: While aboard a non-creature vehicle, adds 1 to power, maneuver and landspeed. May drive transport vehicles.

title: Imperial Code Cylinder
lore: Imperial officers are issued coded cylinders which access computer information via Scomp links. Each cylinder is coded to the officer's own security clearance.
gameText: If any Imperial leader is present with a Scomp link, you may: Glance at the cards in any Reserve Deck for 20 seconds. Shuffle, cut and replace. OR If also at a Death Star site, cancel Scomp Link Access or Into The Garbage Chute, Flyboy.

title: Imperial Reinforcements
